In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate. To His servant Abū al-Ḥamd.
Having arrived - in the company of the assistant to the accountant - Having arrived - in the company of the assistant to the accountant (al-ḥisābī) -
for Shaykh Abū al-Ḥamd are: six containers of flour, for Shaykh Abū al-Ḥamd are: six containers (qiṭʿa) of flour,
and two sacks of rice. The rice is consigned for Abū al-Qāsim and two sacks of rice. The rice is destined for Abū al-Qāsim ... Auf dem (Sack mit dem) Reis ist 'Abū
al-Nājī. He who is to receive them (i.e., the commodities) for safekeeping in a timely manner (?) is the master (al-mawlā). Please write (taktub), on account of them, al-Nājī. He who is to receive them (i.e., the flour and rice) for safekeeping (musallam) in a timely manner is [you], the master (Shaykh Abū Mufarriǧ?). Please write, on account of them, l-Qāsim' geschrieben. ...
